playing_game: ^You've barely managed to reach the third wave of the Xeno Horde--for the very first time--when your phone vibrates.

c: ^It keeps vibrating, of course. It's hard to concentrate.
^You see an orange Kruiper scuttle in from the edge of the screen. You've never seen an orange Kruiper before!

s: ^Ignore the damned phone and go kill that Kruiper!
c: ^The phone keeps buzzing, more intensely now. You try to flank the Wartle line but you're not keeping up.
^This is just going to keep getting worse.
^You reach for the switch on the side of your head, and start to switch it off.
^And you pause. You'd have to explain. And after, almost certainly . . . the disincentives program. It's not worth it. Not quite.

s: ^Answer the phone and keep playing the game at the same time.

g-1: ^Glowy green text appears in your viewer. For a moment, you try keep your game going and read your messages with one eye, but the third wave is something else. You're slaughtered.
^"Report to Supervisor Glenn immediately. EVA repair."
^An EVA repair! If you'd have known that . . . You toss the handheld aside and lift yourself up, heading for the door.
^However, you don't know who Supervisor Glenn is or where in the station he's at. Why do they never explain themselves properly?

c: ^You wait. A few moments later a link appears. It's a map of the ship deck with a pin pointing out Glenn's office, easy to remember.

riding_the_rails: ^The door slides shut behind you. Above is the handheld lift. You climb up and catch a handle.
